member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.ChannelWriter
member.summary: A simpler wrapper to be able to use ChannelWriter as a TextWriter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.ChannelWriter.#ctor(Microsoft.Jupyter.Core.IChannel)
member.summary: The default constructor.
member.param: The channel to write output to.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.CompilationErrorStyle
member.summary: Configuration values for controlling how compilation errors are reported to clients.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.CompilationErrorStyle.Basic
member.summary: Specifies that diagnostics should be formatted as basic strings, similar to MSBuild output logs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.CompilationErrorStyle.Fancy
member.summary: Specifies that diagnostics should be formatted with annotated source and additional links to documentation where appropriate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.ConfigurationSource
member.summary:
An implementation of the
service interface that loads and persists configuration values from and to a local JSON file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.ConfigurationSource.ConfigPath
member.summary: The path of the file use to persist configuration into disk.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.ConfigurationSource.#ctor(Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.IEventService,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new configuration source, loading initial configuration options from the file .iqsharp-config.json, if that file exists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.ConfigurationSource.Persist
member.summary: Persists the current configuration to .iqsharp-config.json.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource
member.summary: A service that controls configuration options, such as those set by preferences, the %config magic command, and so forth.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.Configuration
member.summary: A dictionary of configuration options available from this source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.Persist
member.summary: Persists the current configuration to disk such that a future kernel session launched for the same notebook has the given configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.GetOptionOrDefault``1(System.String,``0,System.Func{System.String,``0})
member.summary: Given the name for a configuration and a default value, returns the given option if it exists, the value of an environment variable if an environment variable with the same name or with the name prefixed with IQSHARP_ exists, or the default if the the option is missing or not available in the environment.
member.param: Name of the option to be retrieved.
Value to be returned when the option specified by has not been set.
A parser to parse the string representation of the option (from the environment) into the corresponding expected Type.
member.typeparam: The expected type of the given option.
member.returns: The value of the option specified by if it exists, otherwise the value of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.GetOptionOrDefault(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Convenience method to call for boolean options.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.GetOptionOrDefault(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Convenience method to call for int options.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.GetOptionOrDefault(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Convenience method to call for uint options.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.GetOptionOrDefault(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Convenience method to call for double options.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.GetOptionOrDefault(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Convenience method to call for string options.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.GetOptionOrDefault``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Convenience method to call for enum options.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.BasisStateLabelingConvention
member.summary: The labeling convention to be used when labeling computational basis states (bit string, little-endian or big-endian).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.TruncateSmallAmplitudes
member.summary: Whether small amplitudes should be truncated when dumping states.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.TruncationThreshold
member.summary:
The threshold for truncating measurement probabilities when dumping states. Computational basis states whose measurement probabilities (i.e: squared magnitudes) are below this threshold are subject to truncation when
is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.PhaseDisplayStyle
member.summary: Allows for options to view phase as arrows, or in radians or both in arrow format and radians. This also allows the option to show None.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.MeasurementDisplayStyle
member.summary: Allows for options to view measurement as horizontal histograms for each basis state, as well as the option to toggle measurement probability as a decimal, progress bar, both, or None.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.MeasurementDisplayPrecision
member.summary: Allows for options to change measurement probability precision when viewing measurement probabilities in a decimal format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.MeasurementDisplayHistogram
member.summary: Allows for option to view basis states as a function of measurement probability in a vertical histogram format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.PlainTextOnly
member.summary: Whether to use only a simple plain-text encoding when dumping states.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.TraceVisualizationDefaultDepth
member.summary: Allows for setting the default depth for visualizing Q# operations using the %trace command.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.TraceVisualizationStyle
member.summary: Allows for setting the default visualization style for visualizing Q# operations using the %trace command.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.NoisySimulatorCapacity
member.summary: Specifies the number of qubits that the open systems simulator supports for use in running Q# programs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.NoisySimulatorRepresentation
member.summary: Specifies the representation to use for the initial state when simulating Q# programs with open systems simulator.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.NoisySimulatorStabilizerStateVisualizationStyle
member.summary: Specifies the format used in dumping stabilizer states.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.ShowHintsOnErrors
member.summary: Specifies whether hints are shown for kernel error messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.CompilationErrorStyle
member.summary: Specifies the format used for reporting Q# compilation errors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.NContextLines
member.summary: Specifies how many lines of context should be displayed around errors and other Q# compilation diagnostics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.SubscriptionId
member.summary: Default SubscriptionId to use when connecting to Azure Quantum. Returns an empty string if not configured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.WorkspaceRG
member.summary: Default Workspace's Resource Group to use when connecting to Azure Quantum. Returns an empty string if not configured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.WorkspaceLocation
member.summary: Default Workspace's location to use when connecting to Azure Quantum. Returns an empty string if not configured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.WorkspaceName
member.summary: Default Workspace's name to use when connecting to Azure Quantum. Returns an empty string if not configured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.EstimatorShowSummary
member.summary: Whether the resource estimation table should be shown in summary mode or not. In summary mode the explanations are shown as a tooltip, otherwise, they are inlined into the table cells. The default value is `false`.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.InternalShowPerf
member.summary: If set to true, shows additional performance breakdowns from within the notebook.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource.InternalShowCompilerPerf
member.summary: If set to true, shows additional performance breakdowns forwarded from the Q# compiler.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.Extensions

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.AbstractMagic
member.summary: Abstract base class for IQ# magic symbols.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.AbstractMagic.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Jupyter.Core.Documentation,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Constructs a new magic symbol given its name and documentation.

member.summary: Given a function representing the execution of a magic command, returns a new function that executes and catches any exceptions that occur during execution. The returned execution function displays the given exceptions to its display channel.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.AbstractMagic.JsonToDict(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the input to a magic command, interpreting the input as a name followed by a JSON-serialized dictionary.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.AbstractMagic.ParseInputParameters(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the input parameters for a given magic symbol and returns a Dictionary with the names and values of the parameters, where the values of the Dictionary are JSON-serialized objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.AbstractMagic.Run(System.String,Microsoft.Jupyter.Core.IChannel)
member.summary: A method to be run when the magic command is executed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.AbstractMagic.RunCancellable(System.String,Microsoft.Jupyter.Core.IChannel,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: A method to be run when the magic command is executed, including a cancellation token to use for requesting cancellation.
member.remarks: The default implementation in ignores the cancellation token. Derived classes should override this method and monitor the cancellation token if they wish to support cancellation.

member.summary: Abstract class for magic commands that can be used to simulate operations and functions on a full-state quantum simulator, using a common C API.

member.summary: Subinterface of with additional functionality for discovering magic symbols.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IMagicSymbolResolver.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the corresponding to the given symbol name, searching all loaded assemblies for classes derived from .
member.param: The magic symbol name to resolve.
member.returns: The resolved object, or null if none was found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IMagicSymbolResolver.AddKernelAssembly``1
member.summary: Given a type representing an assembly, adds that assembly to the list of assemblies to be searched for built-in magic commands.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IMagicSymbolResolver.FindAllMagicSymbols
member.summary: Returns the list of all objects defined in loaded assemblies.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IMagicSymbolResolver.FindMagic(Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.AssemblyInfo)
member.summary: Finds the MagicSymbols inside an assembly, and returns an instance of each.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MagicSymbolResolver
member.summary: A specialized resolver for MagicSymbols. It finds all types that inherit MagicSymbol on the current Assembly and all the Assemblies in global references (including those added via nuget Packages).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MagicSymbolResolver.MundaneAssemblies
member.summary: The simple names of those assemblies which do not need to be searched for display encoders or magic commands.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MagicSymbolResolver.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MagicSymbolResolver},Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.IEventService)
member.summary: Constructs a new magic symbol resolver using the provided services to search assembly references for subclasses of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MagicSymbolResolver.RelevantAssemblies
member.summary: Enumerates over all assemblies that should be searched when resolving symbols.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MagicSymbolResolver.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a given symbol name into a Q# symbol by searching through all relevant assemblies.
member.returns: The symbol instance if resolution is successful, otherwise null.
member.remarks: If the symbol to be resolved contains a dot, it is treated as a fully qualified name, and will only be resolved to a symbol whose name matches exactly. Symbol names without a dot are resolved to the first symbol whose base name matches the given name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.FancyError
member.summary: Represents a diagnostic together with the source that generated that diagnostic.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.FancyError.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServer.Protocol.Diagnostic)
member.summary: Represents a diagnostic together with the source that generated that diagnostic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.FancyError.Hint
member.summary: Returns a user-friendly hint about this diagnostic if one exists, or null if no hint is available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.FancyError.TryGetDocumentationPage
member.summary: Attempts to get a link to a documentation page for this diagnostic.
member.returns: A URI that resolves to a page about this diagnostic if one exists and can be found within the timeout, or null if no such page exists, or if an exception was encountered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.FancyError.AnnotatedSource(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the source for this error, annotated with information from the diagnostic.
member.param: The maximum number of lines of context above and below the diagnostic that should be included in the annotated source.
If true, formats annotated source as an HTML block element.

member.summary: Information about the state to be displayed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StabilizerStateVisualizationStyle
member.summary: Represents different styles for displaying the Q# execution path visualization as HTML.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StabilizerStateVisualizationStyle.MatrixWithDestabilizers
member.summary: Formats stabilizer states as matrices of binary symplectic representations of each generator of the stabilizer group, augmented by the associated anticommuting element for each generator (colloquially known as destabilizers).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StabilizerStateVisualizationStyle.MatrixWithoutDestabilizers
member.summary: Formats stabilizer states as matrices of binary symplectic representations of each generator of the stabilizer group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StabilizerStateVisualizationStyle.DenseGroupPresentation
member.summary: Represents stabilizer states by listing the Pauli matrices that generate the stabilizer group in dense form.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StabilizerStateVisualizationStyle.SparseGroupPresentation
member.summary: Represents stabilizer states by listing the Pauli matrices that generate the stabilizer group in sparse form.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MixedStateToHtmlDisplayEncoder
member.summary: Encodes density operators for display in notebooks and other rich-text contexts.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StabilizerStateToHtmlDisplayEncoder
member.summary: Encodes stabilizer states for display in notebooks and other rich-text contexts.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StabilizerStateToHtmlDisplayEncoder.#ctor(Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.IConfigurationSource)
member.summary: Encodes stabilizer states for display in notebooks and other rich-text contexts.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskProgressToHtmlEncoder.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if a displayable object represents a list of magic symbol summaries, and if so, returns an encoding into an HTML table.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.PhaseDisplayStyle
member.summary: Represents different styles for displaying the phases of complex amplitudes when displaying state vectors as HTML.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.PhaseDisplayStyle.None
member.summary: Suppress phase information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.PhaseDisplayStyle.ArrowOnly
member.summary: Display phase information as an arrow () rotated by an angle dependent on the phase.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.PhaseDisplayStyle.NumberOnly
member.summary: Display phase information in number format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.PhaseDisplayStyle.ArrowAndNumber
member.summary: Display phase information as an arrow () rotated by an angle dependent on the phase as well as display phase information in number format.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MeasurementDisplayStyle
member.summary: Represents different styles for displaying the measurement probability of state vectors as HTML.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MeasurementDisplayStyle.None
member.summary: Suppress measurement probability information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MeasurementDisplayStyle.BarOnly
member.summary: Display measurement probability information as a horizontal histogram.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MeasurementDisplayStyle.NumberOnly
member.summary: Display measurement probability information as a numerical percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.MeasurementDisplayStyle.BarAndNumber
member.summary: Display measurement probability information as a horizontal histogram as well in a numerical percentage format.

member.summary: A result encoder that displays quantum state vectors as HTML tables.

member.summary: Constructs a new result encoder using configuration settings provided by a given configuration source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StateVectorToHtmlResultEncoder.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if a given display object is a state vector, and if so, returns its encoding into an HTML table.

member.summary: A result encoder that displays quantum state vectors as plain-text tables.

member.summary: Constructs a new result encoder using configuration settings provided by a given configuration source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.StateVectorToTextResultEncoder.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if a given display object is a state vector, and if so, returns its encoding into a plain-text table.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatus
member.summary: Represents the status of a task, including its description, completion status, and possibly a subtask description.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatus.LastUpdated
member.summary: The last time at which the status was updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatus.IsCompleted
member.summary: Whether the status represents a completed task.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatus.Description
member.summary: A description of the task represented by this object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatus.Subtask
member.summary: A description of the current subtask for this task (e.g. if the task represents downloading multiple files, which file is currently being downloaded). If there is no applicable subtask, this property should be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatus.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new status given the description of a task.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatusToTextEncoder
member.summary: Encodes the status of IQ# tasks into plain text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatusToTextEncoder.MimeType
member.summary: The MIME type returned by this encoder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TaskStatusToTextEncoder.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if a displayable object is a task status, and if so, returns its encoding into plain text.

member.summary: Represents different styles for displaying the Q# execution path visualization as HTML.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TraceVisualizationStyle.Default
member.summary: Default style with coloured gates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TraceVisualizationStyle.BlackAndWhite
member.summary: Black and white style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.Jupyter.TraceVisualizationStyle.Inverted
member.summary: Inverted black and white style (for black backgrounds).

member.summary: Checks if a displayable object represents a data table, and if so, returns an encoding into an HTML table.

member.summary: Encodes instances as plain-text tables.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Quantum.IQSharp.DataTableToTextEncoder.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if a displayable object represents a data table, and if so, returns an encoding into a plain-text table.

member.summary: Encodes exceptions augmented with Q# metadata into HTML tables.

members.member: Allows using init-only properties in netstandard2.1 project. Note that init-only is only enforced for net5.0 and later callers.
